abstracts.cdata!:
This memorandum seeks approval to amend
            the Development Credit Agreements for the Ethiopia Emergency
            Demobilization and Reintegration Project (Credit 3437-ET,
            EDRP; see report no. P7405). The proposed amendment to the
            credit agreement for the EDRP would support a new component
            aimed at providing additional reintegration assistance to
            food-insecure communities in which veterans have settled in
            order to enhance the sustainability of the veterans'
            reintegration.  These proposed amendments to the
            Demobilization and Reintegration Project for Ethiopia was
            approved on December 5, 2000 and became effective on
            February 22,200 The main development objective of the
            project is to assist the Government of Ethiopia to
            demobilize and reintegrate 150,000 veterans and to support
            macro-economic stability following the cessation of
            hostilities with Eritrea in June 2000.  The Project has
            largely accomplished its Development Objectives and has been
            implemented in a satisfactory manner. The amendments to the
            credit specifically allow for extending 18 months of the
            closing date of the credit to allow for completing ongoing
            activities in support o f the medical and economic
            reintegration of disabled veterans; and add a new component
            that will reallocate cost savings of approximately US$40
            million (SDR 28.08 million) to provide productive safety net
            grants to vulnerable households in food-insecure communities
            in which veterans have resettled. The proposed amendments
            would not have an impact on the overall cost o f the Project.
